intro: Cynoglossum celebicum, commonly known as the Celebes bellflower, is a herbaceous plant native to the Indonesian island of Celebes. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shady areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
